definition: contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel

sentences.english: The earth rotates in counterclockwise direction or from west to east.
sentences.chinese: 地球按照逆时针方向或者由西向东自转。

sentences.english: Release the cap with hand in counterclockwise direction.
sentences.chinese: 用手朝逆时针方向松动盖子。

sentences.english: The pump rotates anticlockwise viewed from the top of motor.
sentences.chinese: 从驱动端往下看泵为逆时针方向旋转。

sentences.english: EL/ELL is the counterclockwise-reeled emboss-tape type.
sentences.chinese: ELL是按逆时针缠绕的压纹带。

sentences.english: Turn the handwheel anti-clockwise to close the Safe.
sentences.chinese: 逆时针转动手轮关闭箱门。

sentences.english: Most people seem to say counterclockwise, and I agree with that.
sentences.chinese: 大部分人说逆时针方向，对此我也表示赞同。

sentences.english: Please widdershins turn the transmitter and the line of the volume potentiometer to the end before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前将话筒及线路音量电位器逆时针转到底。

sentences.english: Stage 3, early Pleistocene, anticlockwise rotation of Luzon arc and continent-arc collision.
sentences.chinese: 更新世，吕宋弧逆时针转动和弧陆碰撞阶段。

sentences.english: Counter-clockwise flow around the low drew up plenty of moisture from the Gulf of Mexico.
sentences.chinese: 逆时针方向环流着从墨西哥湾来的大量湿空气。

sentences.english: Its function is to achieve the right image clockwise and counter-clockwise rotation.
sentences.chinese: 其功能是实现对图象的顺时针和逆时针旋转。

sentences.english: After a sip is taken, the cup is turned the other direction and put back down.
sentences.chinese: 喝完茶以后再逆时针转一下碗，放下来。

sentences.english: We drive anti-clockwise here, which is very demanding.
sentences.chinese: 在这里我们要逆时针驾驶，这对我们要求非常高。

sentences.english: The dance moves in a counter- clockwise direction.
sentences.chinese: 这支舞是按逆时针方向跳的。

sentences.english: Per default, counter-clockwise order indicates the front.
sentences.chinese: 默认地，逆时针方向表示正面。

sentences.english: Androcles . This is Nordhavn. The wind is veering and backing.
sentences.chinese: 风向是逆时针和反时针。

definition: to rotate about an axis/axis of rotation (math.)
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
along/to follow (a line, tradition etc)/to carry on/to trim (a border with braid, tape etc)/border/edge
